text: Michael P. Botticelli (born January 2, 1958) is an American public official. He served as the 7th Director of the White House Office of National Drug Control Policy (ONDCP) from March 2014 until the end of President Barack Obama's term in January 2017. He was named acting director after the resignation of Gil Kerlikowske, and received confirmation from the United States Senate in February 2015. ==Career== As director of ONDCP, Botticelli has advocated to expand the usage of naloxone, improved education for providers around prescription painkillers and providing clean syringes for injection drug users to limit the spread of HIV and Hepatitis C. Botticelli criticized America's dealing with drug issues stating that "We can't arrest and incarcerate addiction out of people", talking about the War on Drugs. He believes the focus should be on treatment rather than putting people in jail. He does support the legalization of cannabis and taxing it. Following the end of the Obama administration, the Grayken Center for Addiction Medicine at the Boston Medical Center named Botticelli its executive director. ==Personal life== Botticelli and his partner have dated since 1995 and were married in 2009. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1958 births Category:Living people Category:Directors of the Office of National Drug Control Policy Category:American LGBT politicians Category:Gay men Category:LGBT people from New York (state) Category:Politicians from New York (state) Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians
